BR_text.BRdescription:
<denchmark-h:h5>System information (version)</denchmark-h>
 
 
 OpenCV => 4.4.0-pre
 
 <denchmark-h:h5>Detailed description</denchmark-h>
 
 The "Structural Analysis and Shape Descriptors" page says "see below for available statistics". I looked through the page a couple of times but couldn't find information on the available statistics.
 <denchmark-h:h5>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
 
 
 Go to https://docs.opencv.org/master/d3/dc0/group__imgproc__shape.html
 Search for "available statistics"
 
 Expected behavior: a list of available statistics should be on the page. Best would be if the text linked there.
 <denchmark-h:h5>Issue submission checklist</denchmark-h>
 
 
  I report the issue, it's not a question
 
 
  I checked the problem with documentation, FAQ, open issues,
 answers.opencv.org, Stack Overflow, etc and have not found solution
 
 
  I updated to latest OpenCV version and the issue is still there
 
 
  There is reproducer code and related data files: videos, images, onnx, etc
 
 <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/188116/85755860-28f14580-b6c3-11ea-9201-335fb5ef4de2.png></denchmark-link>

comments_0.comment_text:
I believe available statistics are listed in <denchmark-link:https://docs.opencv.org/master/d3/dc0/group__imgproc__shape.html#gac7099124c0390051c6970a987e7dc5c5>ConnectedComponentTypes</denchmark-link>
  enum linked in the next sentence (which was "below" in older documentation).
 This sentence can be rephrased, I agree. But this is more of a stylistic problem.
 Feel free to provide a Pull Request.
